column1: Kukawa (previously Kuka) is a town and Local Government Area in the northeastern Nigerian state of Borno
The town was founded in 1814 as capital of the Kanem-Bornu Empire by the Muslim scholar and warlord Muhammad al-Amin al-Kanemi after the fall of the previous capital
column2: Ngazargamu. The town had great strategical importance
column3: being one of the southern terminals of trans-Saharan trade routes to Tripoli.

column2: and again in 1892 by the French explorer Parfait-Louis Monteil
column3: who was checking the borders between areas of West Africa assigned to the French and the British.
